alert.note: Alert for Daviess; Gibson; Knox; Pike (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 22 at 9:17PM EST until December 24 at 7:00AM EST by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... White River at Hazleton affecting Knox and Gibson Counties. White River at Petersburg affecting Pike, Daviess, Gibson and Knox Counties. .Flooding continues from last week`s rainfall. The White River is still in flood from Petersburg to Hazleton, with the river slowly falling. Flooding along the White River is expected to end by Friday evening. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...White River at Petersburg. * WHEN...Until Friday morning. * IMPACTS...At 16.0 feet, Flooding affects agricultural lands. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 PM EST Wednesday /7:30 PM CST Wednesday/ the stage was 16.4 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 8:30 PM EST Wednesday /7:30 PM CST Wednesday/ was 16.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to fall below flood stage tomorrow evening and continue falling to 6.8 feet Saturday, January 01. - Flood stage is 16.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. The next statement should be issued Thursday morning by around 1045 AM CST /1145 AM EST/.
